intro: Genista tinctoria var. plena, commonly known as the full-flowered yellow broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant is distinguished by its dense clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
